posts.aUthor: Eunice Njeri
posts.content: Johannesburg has become an internationally renowned and vibrant metropolis, with over 5.5 million (5,538,596) inhabitants.

posts.title: 10 Habits of The People in Newyork
posts.author: Alex Maina
posts.content: As a Londoner, I dream of visiting New York City, posing with the Wall Street bull and Fearless Girl, walking through Park Avenue or Central Park, eating at a hot dog stand, snapping photos of world leaders outside the United Nations Headquarters, and exploring the New York Public Library, the MoMA and the Met.

posts.title: Why is a Must For You to Visit Kenya
posts.author: Mary Akoth
posts.content: This is probably one of THE most interesting facts about Kenya. Slicing through Kenya from north to south is the Great Rift Valley, also known as the East African Rift Valley. It was formed more than 25 million years ago by geological tension in the earth’s crust and is approximately 6500 kilometres long and 60 kilometres wide. The wide valley allowed for many lakes to form, creating unique habitats for the country’s wildlife.

posts.title: Why Mombasa Attract More Tourist
posts.author: Jane Auma
posts.content: Mombasa, with a population of 900,000, is no sleepy seaside village. Its beachfront hotels appeal to travelers in search of sun, sand and surf, while its Arab, Indian and colonial European heritage makes for a wide variety of sights to see

posts.author: Alice Njer
posts.content: The pricing of hotels has many factors to it, such as the service, the view ,location ,size and many other facts

posts.author: Becky Moore
posts.content: took a break to this peaceful and scenic region this month and found the weather warm and sunny – perfect for all the outdoor activities on offer, from swimming in the lakes to hiking through lush greenery, with pretty summer flowers blooming everywhere and a laid-back vacation vibe all around!
